title: The 10 best things to do in Hong Kong
text:
The 10 best things to do in Hong Kong The 10 best things to do in Hong Kong 24 HOURS daylight, skyscrapers, traditional Chinese food and tai chi: Hong Kong is the ultimate city break. PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 00:01, Sat, Jul 18, 2015 SAT MAG Take some time out for a t’ai chi session in one of Hong Kong’s parks 
1. Practise your haggling at the Temple Street night market in the Kowloon district. 
2. Enjoy a harbour cruise on the Aqua Luna, a traditional Chinese junk. See aqualuna.com.hk . 
3.. Take the steep tram ride up Victoria Peak to take in the views across Hong Kong island. Visit thepeak.com.hk . 
4. Visit some of the last remaining dai pai dong – traditional street food stalls – near the Mong Kok MTR station – and try har gow (steamed shrimp dumplings). 
5. Pop over to Macau, just a 50-minute ferry ride from the centre of Hong Kong. See some of its most spectacular hotels, including the Venetian, with its singing gondoliers, and the MGM Macau. SAT MAG Try har gow -steamed shrimp dumplings 
6. Enjoy a mojito and the fantastic views across Kowloon at the Aqua Spirit bar. See aqua.com.hk . 
7. Hop on the MTR, Hong Kong’s underground, it’s cheap, clean and easy to negotiate. 
8. Ride the Central-Mid-Levels – the world’s longest outdoor covered escalator system. Allow 20 minutes for a one-way journey! 
9. Take some time out for a t’ai chi session in one of Hong Kong’s parks. Many hotels, including the Eaton Hong Kong, offer beginner classes. See hongkong.eatonhotels.com . 
10. Visit Lantau Island, home to the Tian Tan Buddha and the Po Lin Monastery, two of the world’s most important Buddhist sites. Related articles
